WorkItem.ClosedComment: PLEASE SEARCH FOR EXISTING ISSUES BEFORE POSTING NEW ONES.WE *STILL* DO NOT NEED A NEW FRELLING RE-POST OF THIS EVERY FRELLING DAY.
WorkItem.Description:
When I attempt to load my char from armory, I get
 
[Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException]
Arguments:
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=3.0.50106.0&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException
 
   at Rawr.Warlock.CalculationOptionsWarlock.GetBaseHitRate()
   at Rawr.Warlock.CharacterCalculationsWarlock..ctor(Character character, Stats stats)
   at Rawr.Warlock.CalculationsWarlock.GetCharacterCalculations(Character character, Item additionalItem, Boolean referenceCalculation, Boolean significantChange, Boolean needsDisplayCalculations)
   at Rawr.CalculationsBase.GetItemCalculations(ItemInstance item, Character character, CharacterSlot slot)
   at Rawr.Calculations.GetItemCalculations(ItemInstance item, Character character, CharacterSlot slot)
   at Rawr.UI.ItemListControl.BuildListItems()
   at Rawr.UI.ItemListControl.set_IsShown(Boolean value)
   at Rawr.UI.ItemButtonWithEnchant.MainButton_Clicked(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Button.OnClick()
   at System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.Control.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(Control ctrl, EventArgs e)
   at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, String eventName)
 
Upon closing the error window, I get the "waiting" cursor, and when I attempt to do anything else, such as click on an item, change a buff, etc. the same window pops up again. Also, this slows the program down to a crawl, basically making it completely unusable. I have no problems on my shadow priest, paladin or mage like this. However, in order to use the program for the other classes once I've tried the warlock, I must first quit it, then reopen it, or I keep getting the aforementioned error message repeatedly.
